data.content: Test with multiple words like this and this here
Octopuses can regrow lost arms.
Sloths move so slowly that algae grow on their fur.
Flamingos get their pink color from the food they eat.
Elephants mourn their dead and show empathy.
Cows can remember things for a long time and hold grudges.
Seahorses use their tails to anchor to seagrasses and corals.
There are over 6,000 species of frogs.
Snails can have thousands of tiny teeth on their tongue-like organ called a radula.
Shrimp are found on every continent’s coastline.
Butterflies cannot fly if they are cold.
Octopuses are considered highly intelligent and can solve puzzles.
A sloth’s grip is so strong it can stay attached to a tree even after death.
Flamingos often stand on one leg to conserve body heat.
African elephants have larger ears than Asian elephants.
Cows have four stomach compartments.
Seahorses have no stomach and must eat constantly.
Some frogs can leap over 20 times their body length.
Snails move using a muscular foot that produces mucus.
Shrimp can change color to blend in with surroundings.
Butterflies undergo complete metamorphosis from caterpillar to adult.
Octopuses can change the texture of their skin to blend into their surroundings.
Sloths come down from trees only once a week to defecate.
Flamingos form strong pair bonds during mating season.
Elephants use their trunks to smell, breathe, trumpet, drink, and grab things.
Cows lie down and stand up around 14 times a day.
Seahorses swim upright unlike most fish.
Frogs use their eyes to help push food down their throat.
Some species of snail can live up to 25 years.
Some shrimp species can snap their claws to create bubbles that stun prey.
Butterflies taste with their feet using chemoreceptors.
Some octopuses use coconut shells as mobile shelters.
Sloths have a four-part stomach to help digest tough leaves.
Flamingos filter-feed by holding their beaks upside down in the water.
Elephants communicate using infrasound below human hearing levels.
Cows have nearly 300-degree panoramic vision.
Seahorses mate for life in many species.
Frogs absorb water through their skin instead of drinking.
Some land snails can climb trees and even glass.
Cleaner shrimp remove parasites from other fish.
Butterflies have a liquid diet and drink nectar using a proboscis.
Octopuses have no bones, allowing them to squeeze through tiny gaps.
Sloths can turn their heads up to 270 degrees.
Baby flamingos are born with gray feathers.
Elephants have excellent memories and can recognize individuals after years.
Cows can smell something up to six miles away.
Seahorses are poor swimmers and often rely on camouflage.
Some frogs are poisonous and can be lethal to predators.
Snails are hermaphrodites, meaning they have both male and female organs.
Shrimp have compound eyes that give them a wide field of vision.
Some butterflies migrate thousands of miles, like the monarch.
